head.title: World Briefing | Asia: North Korea: U.N. Inspectors Welcome, If . . .

hedline.hl1: World Briefing | Asia: North Korea: U.N. Inspectors Welcome, If . . .

abstract.p: North Korea reiterates that it will allow international nuclear inspectors into country as soon as it can confirm that funds frozen in Macao bank have been released (S)

block.p: North Korea reiterated that it would allow international nuclear inspectors into the country as soon as it could confirm that funds frozen in a Macao bank had been released. According to the official Korean Central News Agency, Ri Je-son, the director general of North Korea's Atomic Energy Department, delivered that message in a response to a request by the International Atomic Energy Agency to send inspectors. North Korea repeated that it remained committed to a Feb. 13 agreement under which it would allow inspectors in and shut down its Yongbyon nuclear plant in return for energy aid.
